INT cm_check_client ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKeyClient 
)

Check if a client with a /system/client/xxx entry has a valid entry in the ODB client table. If not, remove that client from the /system/client tree.

Parameters:
hDB Handle to online database
hKeyClient Handle to client key
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, CM_NO_CLIENT

INT cm_check_deferred_transition ( void   ) 

Check for any deferred transition. If a deferred transition handler has been registered via the cm_register_deferred_transition function, this routine should be called regularly. It checks if a transition request is pending. If so, it calld the registered handler if the transition should be done and then actually does the transition.

Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, <error> Error from cm_transition()

03493          if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == _requested_transition)

03495

INT cm_cleanup ( char *  client_name,
BOOL  ignore_timeout 
)

Remove hanging clients independent of their watchdog timeout.

Since this function does not obey the client watchdog timeout, it should be only called to remove clients which have their watchdog checking turned off or which are known to be dead. The normal client removement is done via cm_watchdog().

Currently (Sept. 02) there are two applications for that:

  1. The ODBEdit command "cleanup", which can be used to remove clients which have their watchdog checking off, like the analyzer started with the "-d" flag for a debugging session.
  2. The frontend init code to remove previous frontends. This can be helpful if a frontend dies. Normally, one would have to wait 60 sec. for a crashed frontend to be removed. Only then one can start again the frontend. Since the frontend init code contains a call to cm_cleanup(<frontend_name>), one can restart a frontend immediately.

Added ignore_timeout on Nov.03. A logger might have an increased tiemout of up to 60 sec. because of tape operations. If ignore_timeout is FALSE, the logger is then not killed if its inactivity is less than 60 sec., while in the previous implementation it was always killed after 2*WATCHDOG_INTERVAL.

Parameters:
client_name Client name, if zero check all clients
ignore_timeout If TRUE, ignore a possible increased timeout defined by each client.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

05244                if (j != _database[i].client_index && pdbclient->pid &&
05245                    (client_name[0] == 0
05246                     || strncmp(pdbclient->name, client_name, strlen(client_name)) == 0)) {
05247                   client_pid = pdbclient->tid;
05248                   if (ignore_timeout)
05249                      interval = 2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05250                   else
05251                      interval = pdbclient->watchdog_timeout;
05252 
05253                   /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05254 
05255                   if (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05256                      bDeleted = FALSE;
05257                      str[0] = 0;
05258 
05259                      /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05260                      if (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05261                         sprintf(str,
05262                                 "Client %s on %s removed (via cleanup) (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05263                                 pdbclient->name, pdbheader->name,
05264                                 (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
05265                                 interval / 1000.0);
05266 
05267                         /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
05268                         for (k = 0; k < pdbclient->max_index; k++)
05269                            if (pdbclient->open_record[k].handle) {
05270                               pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pdbheader +
05271                                               pdbclient->open_record[k].handle);
05272                               if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
05273                                  pkey->notify_count--;
05274 
05275                               if (pdbclient->open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
05276                                  db_set_mode(i + 1, pdbclient->open_record[k].handle,
05277                                              (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE),
05278                                              2);
05279                            }
05280 
05281                         /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
05282                         memset(&(pdbheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
05283 
05284                         /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
05285                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
05286                            if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05287                               break;
05288                         pdbheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
05289 
05290                         /* count new number of clients */
05291                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
05292                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05293                               nc++;
05294                         pdbheader->num_clients = nc;
05295 
05296                         bDeleted = TRUE;
05297                      }
05298 
05299 
05300                      /* delete client entry after unlocking db */
05301                      if (bDeleted) {
05302                         db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05303 
05304                         /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
05305                         cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_cleanup", str);
05306 
05307                         status = cm_delete_client_info(i + 1, client_pid);
05308                         if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
05309                            cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_cleanup", "cannot delete client info");
05310 
05311                         /* re-lock database */
05312                         db_lock_database(i + 1);
05313                         pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05314                         pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05315 
05316                         /* go again though whole list */
05317                         j = 0;
05318                      }
05319                   }
05320                }
05321 
05322             db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05323          }
05324 
05325    }
05326 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05327 
05328    return CM_SUCCESS;
05329 }

INT cm_connect_experiment ( char *  host_name,
char *  exp_name,
char *  client_name,
void(*)(char *)  func 
)

dox This function connects to an existing MIDAS experiment. This must be the first call in a MIDAS application. It opens three TCP connection to the remote host (one for RPC calls, one to send events and one for hot-link notifications from the remote host) and writes client information into the ODB under /System/Clients.

Attention:
All MIDAS applications should evaluate the MIDAS_SERVER_HOST and MIDAS_EXPT_NAME environment variables as defaults to the host name and experiment name (see Environment_variables). For that purpose, the function cm_get_environment() should be called prior to cm_connect_experiment(). If command line parameters -h and -e are used, the evaluation should be done between cm_get_environment() and cm_connect_experiment(). The function cm_disconnect_experiment() must be called before a MIDAS application exits. 
#include <stdio.h>
#include <midas.h>
main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  INT  status, i;
  char host_name[256],exp_name[32];

  // get default values from environment
  cm_get_environment(host_name, exp_name);

  // parse command line parameters
  for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
    {
    if (argv[i][0] == '-')
      {
      if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
        goto usage;
      if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
        strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
      else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
        strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
      else
        {
usage:
        printf("usage: test [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment]\n\n");
        return 1;
        }
      }
    }
  status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Test", NULL);
  if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
    return 1;
  ...do operations...
  cm_disconnect_experiment();
}
Parameters:
host_name Specifies host to connect to. Must be a valid IP host name. The string can be empty ("") if to connect to the local computer.
exp_name Specifies the experiment to connect to. If this string is empty, the number of defined experiments in exptab is checked. If only one experiment is defined, the function automatically connects to this one. If more than one experiment is defined, a list is presented and the user can interactively select one experiment.
client_name Client name of the calling program as it can be seen by others (like the scl command in ODBEdit).
func Callback function to read in a password if security has been enabled. In all command line applications this function is NULL which invokes an internal ss_gets() function to read in a password. In windows environments (MS Windows, X Windows) a function can be supplied to open a dialog box and read in the password. The argument of this function must be the returned password.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, CM_UNDEF_EXP, CM_SET_ERROR, RPC_NET_ERROR
CM_VERSION_MISMATCH MIDAS library version different on local and remote computer

INT cm_disconnect_experiment ( void   ) 

Disconnect from a MIDAS experiment.

Attention:
Should be the last call to a MIDAS library function in an application before it exits. This function removes the client information from the ODB, disconnects all TCP connections and frees all internal allocated memory. See cm_connect_experiment() for example.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 2768 of file midas.c.

INT cm_get_environment ( char *  host_name,
int  host_name_size,
char *  exp_name,
int  exp_name_size 
)

Returns MIDAS environment variables.

Attention:
This function can be used to evaluate the standard MIDAS environment variables before connecting to an experiment (see Environment_variables). The usual way is that the host name and experiment name are first derived from the environment variables MIDAS_SERVER_HOST and MIDAS_EXPT_NAME. They can then be superseded by command line parameters with -h and -e flags. 
#include <stdio.h>
#include <midas.h>
main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  INT  status, i;
  char host_name[256],exp_name[32];

  // get default values from environment
  cm_get_environment(host_name, exp_name);

  // parse command line parameters
  for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
    {
    if (argv[i][0] == '-')
      {
      if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
        goto usage;
      if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
        strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
      else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
        strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
      else
        {
usage:
        printf("usage: test [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment]\n\n");
        return 1;
        }
      }
    }
  status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Test", NULL);
  if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
    return 1;
    ...do anyting...
  cm_disconnect_experiment();
}
Parameters:
host_name Contents of MIDAS_SERVER_HOST environment variable.
host_name_size string length
exp_name Contents of MIDAS_EXPT_NAME environment variable.
exp_name_size string length
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

INT cm_register_transition ( INT  transition,
INT(*)(INT, char *)  func,
INT  sequence_number 
)

dox Registers a callback function for run transitions. This function internally registers the transition callback function and publishes its request for transition notification by writing a transition request to /System/Clients/<pid>/Transition XXX. Other clients making a transition scan the transition requests of all clients and call their transition callbacks via RPC.

Clients can register for transitions (Start/Stop/Pause/Resume) in a given sequence. All sequence numbers given in the registration are sorted on a transition and the clients are contacted in ascending order. By default, all programs register with a sequence number of 500. The logger however uses 200 for start, so that it can open files before the other clients are contacted, and 800 for stop, so that the files get closed when all other clients have gone already through the stop trantition.

The callback function returns CM_SUCCESS if it can perform the transition or a value larger than one in case of error. An error string can be copied into the error variable.

Attention:
The callback function will be called on transitions from inside the cm_yield() function which therefore must be contained in the main program loop. 
INT start(INT run_number, char *error)
{
  if (<not ok>)
    {
    strcpy(error, "Cannot start because ...");
    return 2;
    }
  printf("Starting run %d\n", run_number);
  return CM_SUCCESS;
}
main()
{
  ...
  cm_register_transition(TR_START, start, 500);
  do
    {
    status = cm_yield(1000);
    } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN &&
             status != SS_ABORT);
  ...
}
Parameters:
transition Transition to register for (see )
func Callback function.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

INT cm_set_watchdog_params ( BOOL  call_watchdog,
DWORD  timeout 
)

dox Sets the internal watchdog flags and the own timeout. If call_watchdog is TRUE, the cm_watchdog routine is called periodically from the system to show other clients that this application is "alive". On UNIX systems, the alarm() timer is used which is then not available for user purposes.

The timeout specifies the time, after which the calling application should be considered "dead" by other clients. Normally, the cm_watchdog() routines is called periodically. If a client crashes, this does not occur any more. Then other clients can detect this and clear all buffer and database entries of this application so they are not blocked any more. If this application should not checked by others, the timeout can be specified as zero. It might be useful for debugging purposes to do so, because if a debugger comes to a breakpoint and stops the application, the periodic call of cm_watchdog is disabled and the client looks like dead.

If the timeout is not zero, but the watchdog is not called (call_watchdog == FALSE), the user must ensure to call cm_watchdog periodically with a period of WATCHDOG_INTERVAL milliseconds or less.

An application which calles system routines which block the alarm signal for some time, might increase the timeout to the maximum expected blocking time before issuing the calls. One example is the logger doing Exabyte tape IO, which can take up to one minute.

Parameters:
call_watchdog Call the cm_watchdog routine periodically
timeout Timeout for this application in ms
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 3000 of file midas.c.

References _buffer_entries, _database_entries, BUFFER::buffer_header, DATABASE_HEADER::client, BUFFER_HEADER::client, DATABASE::client_index, BUFFER::client_index, cm_get_experiment_database(), CM_SUCCESS, cm_watchdog(), DATABASE::database_header, db_lock_database(), db_set_mode(), db_set_value(), db_unlock_database(), hDB, hKey, i, index, DATABASE_CLIENT::last_activity, BUFFER_CLIENT::last_activity, MODE_READ, MODE_WRITE, rpc_call(), RPC_CM_SET_WATCHDOG_PARAMS, rpc_get_server_acception(), rpc_get_server_option(), rpc_is_remote(), RPC_OSERVER_TYPE, rpc_set_server_option(), RPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT, ss_alarm(), ss_gettid(), ss_millitime(), ST_REMOTE, ST_SINGLE, TID_INT, TRUE, WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, DATABASE_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout, and BUFFER_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout.

INT cm_transition ( INT  transition,
INT  run_number,
char *  perror,
INT  strsize,
INT  async_flag,
INT  debug_flag 
)

Performs a run transition (Start/Stop/Pause/Resume).

Synchronous/Asynchronous flag. If set to ASYNC, the transition is done asynchronously, meaning that clients are connected and told to execute their callback routine, but no result is awaited. The return value is specified by the transition callback function on the remote clients. If all callbacks can perform the transition, CM_SUCCESS is returned. If one callback cannot perform the transition, the return value of this callback is returned from cm_transition(). The async_flag is usually FALSE so that transition callbacks can block a run transition in case of problems and return an error string. The only exception are situations where a run transition is performed automatically by a program which cannot block in a transition. For example the logger can cause a run stop when a disk is nearly full but it cannot block in the cm_transition() function since it has its own run stop callback which must flush buffers and close disk files and tapes. 

...
    i = 1;
    db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);

      status = cm_transition(TR_START, new_run_number, str, sizeof(str), SYNC, debug_flag);
      if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
      {
        // in case of error
        printf("Error: %s\n", str);
      }
    ...
Parameters:
transition TR_START, TR_PAUSE, TR_RESUME or TR_STOP.
run_number New run number. If zero, use current run number plus one.
perror returned error string.
strsize Size of error string.
async_flag SYNC: synchronization flag (SYNC:wait completion, ASYNC: retun immediately)
debug_flag If 1 output debugging information, if 2 output via cm_msg().
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, <error> error code from remote client

03750       size = sizeof(state);
03751       status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/State", &state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03752       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03753          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot get Runinfo/State in database");
03754 
03755       if (state != STATE_STOPPED) {
03756          /* stop time binary */
03757          cm_time(&seconds);
03758          status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time binary",
03759                                &seconds, sizeof(seconds), 1, TID_DWORD);
03760          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03761             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition",
03762                    "cannot set \"Runinfo/Stop Time binary\" in database");
03763 
03764          /* stop time ascii */
03765          cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
03766          status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time", str, 32, 1, TID_STRING);
03767          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03768             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition",
03769                    "cannot set \"Runinfo/Stop Time\" in database");
03770       }
03771    }
03772 
03773    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hRootKey);
03774    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03775       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot find System/Clients entry in database");
03776       return status;
03777    }
03778 
03779    for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03780       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03781          break;
03782 
03783    if (debug_flag == 1)
03784       printf("---- Transition %s started ----\n", trans_name[i].name);
03785    if (debug_flag == 2)
03786       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: ---- Transition %s started ----", trans_name[i].name);
03787

03789 
03790    /* search database for clients which registered for transition */
03791    n_tr_clients = 0;
03792    tr_client = NULL;
03793 
03794    for (i = 0, status = 0;; i++) {
03795       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hSubkey);
03796       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03797          break;
03798

03801

03803

03805 
03806             for (j=0 ; j<key.num_values ; j++) {
03807                size = sizeof(sequence_number);
03808                status = db_get_data_index(hDB, hKeyTrans, &sequence_number, &size, j, TID_INT);
03809                assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
03810 
03811                if (tr_client == NULL)
03812                   tr_client = (TR_CLIENT *) malloc(sizeof(TR_CLIENT));
03813                else

03816

03822                } else {

03826                   strcpy(tr_client[n_tr_clients].client_name, client_name);
03827

03831

03834                   strcpy(tr_client[n_tr_clients].host_name, host_name);
03835                }
03836 
03837                n_tr_clients++;
03838             }
03839          }
03840       }
03841    }
03842 
03843    /* sort clients according to sequence number */
03844    if (n_tr_clients > 1)
03845       qsort(tr_client, n_tr_clients, sizeof(TR_CLIENT), tr_compare);
03846 
03847    /* contact ordered clients for transition */
03848    for (index=0 ; index<n_tr_clients; index++) {
03849       /* erase error string */
03850       error[0] = 0;
03851 
03852       if (debug_flag == 1)
03853          printf("\n==== Found client \"%s\" with sequence number %d\n", tr_client[index].client_name, 
03854             tr_client[index].sequence_number);
03855       if (debug_flag == 2)
03856          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: ==== Found client \"%s\" with sequence number %d",
03857             tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].sequence_number);
03858 
03859       /* if own client call transition callback directly */
03860       if (tr_client[index].port == 0) {
03861          for (i = 0; _trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03862             if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition)
03863                break;
03864 
03865          /* call registerd function */
03866          if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition && _trans_table[i].func) {
03867             if (debug_flag == 1)
03868                printf("Calling local transition callback\n");
03869             if (debug_flag == 2)
03870                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Calling local transition callback");
03871 
03872             status = _trans_table[i].func(run_number, error);
03873 
03874             if (debug_flag == 1)
03875                printf("Local transition callback finished\n");
03876             if (debug_flag == 2)
03877                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Local transition callback finished");
03878          } else
03879             status = CM_SUCCESS;
03880 
03881          if (perror != NULL)
03882             memcpy(perror, error, (INT) strlen(error) + 1 < strsize ?
03883                      strlen(error) + 1 : strsize);
03884 
03885          if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
03886             free(tr_client);
03887             return status;
03888          }
03889 
03890       } else {
03891          
03892          /* contact client if transition mask set */
03893          if (debug_flag == 1)
03894             printf("Connecting to client \"%s\" on host %s...\n", 
03895                tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03896          if (debug_flag == 2)
03897             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03898                "cm_transition: Connecting to client \"%s\" on host %s...", 
03899                tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03900

03903                                      tr_client[index].client_name, &hConn);
03904          if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
03905             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot connect to client \"%s\" on host %s, port %d",
03906                      tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name, 
03907                      tr_client[index].port);

03909          }
03910

03912             printf("Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s\n", 
03913               tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03914          if (debug_flag == 2)
03915             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03916                "cm_transition: Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s", 
03917                 tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03918 
03919          /* call RC_TRANSITION on remote client with increased timeout */
03920          old_timeout = rpc_get_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT);
03921          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, 120000);
03922 
03923          /* set FTPC protocol if in async mode */
03924          if (async_flag == ASYNC)

03926 
03927          if (debug_flag== 1)

03933                  tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03934 
03935          status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_RC_TRANSITION, transition,
03936             run_number, error, strsize, tr_client[index].sequence_number);
03937 
03938          /* reset timeout */
03939          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, old_timeout);
03940 
03941          /* reset protocol */
03942          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
03943             rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
03944 
03945          if (debug_flag == 1)
03946             printf("RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s\n", 
03947               tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);

03949             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03950                "cm_transition: RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s", 
03951                  tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);

03955                      strlen(error) + 1 : strsize);
03956 
03957          if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
03958             free(tr_client);
03959             return status;
03960          }
03961       }
03962    }
03963 
03964    if (tr_client)
03965       free(tr_client);
03966 
03967    for (i = 0; i < 13; i++)
03968       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03969          break;
03970 
03971    if (debug_flag == 1)
03972       printf("\n---- Transition %s finished ----\n", trans_name[i].name);
03973    if (debug_flag == 2)
03974       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition",

03977    /* set new run state in database */

03979       state = STATE_RUNNING;
03980 
03981    if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
03982       state = STATE_PAUSED;
03983 
03984    if (transition == TR_STOP)

03991 
03992    /* send notification message */
03993    str[0] = 0;
03994    if (transition == TR_START)
03995       sprintf(str, "Run #%d started", run_number);
03996    if (transition == TR_STOP)
03997       sprintf(str, "Run #%d stopped", run_number);
03998    if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
03999       sprintf(str, "Run #%d paused", run_number);
04000    if (transition == TR_RESUME)
04001       sprintf(str, "Run #%d resumed", run_number);
04002 
04003    if (str[0])
04004       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", str);
04005 
04006    /* lock/unlock ODB values if present */
04007    db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Lock when running", &hKey);
04008    if (hKey && transition == TR_START)
04009       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
04010    if (hKey && transition == TR_STOP)
04011       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
04012 
04013    /* flush online database */
04014    if (transition == TR_STOP)
04015       db_flush_database(hDB);
04016 
04017    /* execute/stop programs on stop */
04018    if (transition == TR_STOP) {
04019       str[0] = 0;
04020       size = sizeof(str);
04021       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Programs/Execute on stop run", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
04022       if (str[0])
04023          ss_system(str);
04024 
04025       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Programs", &hRootKey);
04026       if (hRootKey) {
04027          for (i = 0;; i++) {
04028             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hKey);
04029             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
04030                break;
04031 
04032             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
04033 
04034             /* don't check "execute on xxx" */
04035             if (key.type != TID_KEY)
04036                continue;
04037 
04038             size = sizeof(program_info);
04039             status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, &program_info, &size, 0);
04040             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
04041                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Cannot get program info record");
04042                continue;
04043             }
04044 
04045             if (program_info.auto_stop)
04046                cm_shutdown(key.name, FALSE);
04047          }
04048       }
04049    }
04050 
04051    /* send notification */
04052    if (transition == TR_START) {
04053       int sock, size;
04054       struct sockaddr_in addr;
04055       char buffer[512], str[256];
04056 
04057       sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
04058       memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
04059       addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
04060       addr.sin_port = htons((short) MIDAS_TCP_PORT);
04061       addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(2172773399u);
04062 
04063       str[0] = 0;
04064       size = sizeof(str);
04065       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
04066       sprintf(buffer, "%s %s %d", str, cm_get_version(), run_number);
04067       sendto(sock, buffer, strlen(buffer), 0, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(addr));
04068       closesocket(sock);
04069    }
04070 
04071    return CM_SUCCESS;
04072 }

void cm_watchdog ( int  dummy  ) 

Called at periodic intervals, checks if all clients are alive. If one process died, its client entries are cleaned up.

Parameters:
dummy unused!

INT cm_yield ( INT  millisec  ) 

dox Central yield functions for clients. This routine should be called in an infinite loop by a client in order to give the MIDAS system the opportunity to receive commands over RPC channels, update database records and receive events.

Parameters:
millisec Timeout in millisec. If no message is received during the specified timeout, the routine returns. If millisec=-1, it only returns when receiving an RPC_SHUTDOWN message.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, RPC_SHUTDOWN
